forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. Southwest wind 14 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As a gentle rain begins to drape Downtown San Francisco, the city awakens under a thick, gray blanket of clouds, shrouded in a cloak of moisture. The vibrant energy of the streets is tempered by the incoming weather, as umbrellas scatter like wildflowers against the sidewalks where life insists on its rhythm. Though the day promises a high of 57, a chill in the air reminds one that this is not the sunlit embrace of summer; temperatures will dip, and winds will howl, reaching up to 36 mph, as if nature itself exclaims the arrival of spring's tempestuous moods. The horizon whispers of thunder, hints of electric brilliance lingering in the brooding clouds, while the prospect of substantial rainfall persists—enough to drench the parched earth.

For those braving the elements, preparation is key. A good waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes might save one from the inevitable splashes of puddles forming in the city’s nooks and crannies. As the night climbs higher and temperatures nudge upwards in a peculiar dance, the prospect of varied indoor activities emerges. Perhaps a quiet afternoon sipping a rich, dark coffee in a favorite corner café while watching the world rush by; or perhaps an invitation to explore the depths of a captivating museum—where the realms of art and history promise escapism from the elements outside. Tonight calls for an embrace of warmth, as the storms persist, offering a reminder of nature’s mercurial beauty.
